top_comments.comment: Visit https://simplisafe.com/modustrial to learn more and to get at least 30% off your SimpliSafe security system!

comments_since_last_sample.body: The day you post the video of scraping the peeling paint off the garage ceiling roof is the day you'll get 69million views my friend
Go for the handles, No handles on a matte black with push open will leave you endlessly cleaning it. Trust me! Smudge galore!
Looks like a lot of work ahead! GL!
Push to open with the hidden pulls in matte black sounds sick as hell!
Hey Mike, quick assembly tip from a cabinet guy, install the slides to the cabinet sides before assembling the cabinet. Then you don't have to awkwardly reach inside each cabinet to install them!
Are you gonna get in on #teamseas?
I would do push to open, soft close slides. Will look super sleek and you won't need to use the pulls and hence won't accidentally get stuff caught on the pulls when walking past.
Push to open with black cabinets is a bad idea in my experience. Always very visible oiled finger prints on the cabinet doors.
I personally don't like push to open so i won't recommend them. Also be careful with your credit card there a faire few digits that are readable for the video.
You’re using medium density board (aka particle board) for your cabinets instead of cabinet-grade plywood? 😳🤦🏼🤦🏼‍♂️ Going cheap isn’t always a good thing. Cheap construction = shoddy construction.
Push to open is nicer. Also don’t ever show your card even slightly…
The push drawer choice would keep your cabinets flush and look minimalist  : )
Push to open takes two actions to open and a handle just takes one. Take that into consideration for the thousands of times you will open the cabinets.
No pulls do push sliders it be easier and slick clean.look

16:20 MDF is nice, but have you heard of HDF?
           While nether does well around water, HDF does fair better.
